Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the bowels of hell”
Reviews.Author: lmorinHangzhouchina
Reviews.Content: I took a last minute trip to Hong Kong and did not book anywhere so I was pretty desperate as every hotel that I crossed was fully booked. I paid 500 HKD for the room sight unseen which proved to be a mistake. The room was grotesque-tiny, not very clean, a nasty, stained bathroom with a floppy wooden door, antique plumbing and no soap, toilet paper etc. and smelled nasty. I think that the thing that surprised me the most was that there were two large suitcases taking up a good portion of the room (storage I'm guessing). I had to have a few drinks in order to be able to return to it. The location was good but I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but tidy”
Reviews.Author: ORita46
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, which I found out is expected in Hong Kong. I've stayed with my boyfriend for 4 nights. Space is one thing, the main problem was the bathroom. It's in the room like 20 cm away from the bed and it was see through, literally see through. Taking a shower is one thing but using the toilet was quite an experience. Everytime one of us had to use toiled the other one had to put on a headset, turn back and put a pillow over the head. And the elevator is pretty bad, with many scary looking people on the ground floor. Now about the pros: it's cheap, the location is the best, close to everything, very clean, the lady changes the towels and bed sheets everyday, aircon works just fine, the bed and pillows were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Adequete”
Reviews.Author: Spiffle
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 12 nights so we got to know it pretty well. Before we got to the hotel we received an email from them telling us exactly how to get to there and gave us warning of 'touts' (randoms who want to take advantage of us). The hotel is located in a huge building, as is to be expected in Hong Kong, and is on the 15th floor. The front entrance has upwards of 15 hawkers at one time trying to get your attention, walking in front of you, saying variations of; "room?", "watch?," "suit?". There are two elevators. One services the even number of levels and the other services the odd numbers. During peak times there is a line to these elevators and a guard is around to monitor or shove more people into or out of the elevators. The elevator is tiny. We're talking public toilet cubicle tiny. Most of the time if we saw a queue of people we opted for the stairs since the elevator would take forever. Take note, if you do decide to use the stairs they can be a bit eerie. Though we were never met with any danger per say it did make us weary. On our first adventure up the stairs we were asked if we wanted any drugs! Onto the hotel! The rooms are tiny. To be expected. The shower is literally over the toilet so I suggest you remove all the toilet paper from the bathroom before taking a sower. The bed can move up to the roof level which we found handy to clear up some, minimal space, by putting our bags under the bed. This at least made a clear pathway to the door. You have a tv, air conditioning and mini fridge. The tv worked well. Room service was daily. The woman who worked there was lovely and had little English but tried her best when we asked her questions about places. There is a hot water dispenser available and we found a dry cleaners on the first floor of the building. There was work going on when we were staying, and I imagine it will forever be going on, but since we were on the 15th floor the sound was minimal. There is a station close by which made it incredibly easy for us to travel around. The hotel is also located within walking distance to the art gallery and space museum which have free entry on specific days. Also across the street from the hotel is an imax cinema. A block away is a post office, especially awesome when you happen to buy a lot of stuff to send back home. There is a supermarket by the train station, about 2 blocks away. It has a bakery out the front which proved to be a necessity in providing us with our lunches for the day. Also the airport bus is right outside of the hotel. Made it super easy for us when we had to leave at 4am in the morning. I was very satisfied with this hotel. It provided what I expected. However the hawkers out the front just do. not. stop. Literally we would walk past the same people and they would still harass us even if they only saw us 15 minutes before. We had one guy follow us for a block yelling obscenities because we didn't care about what he was selling. If you cannot deal with hawkers then I suggest you stay far far away from the Park Guest House. If you can deal with hawkers then I would recommend the Park Guest House as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super small”
Reviews.Author: WeilekHo
Reviews.Content: Small room is expected before I check in, but I was shocked the room is smaller than my expectation. We stayed in twin room with bathroom attached, the overall just like 4ft x 8ft, occupied by 2 single bed + bathroom (estimated 2ft x 4ft), the only space for 2 people to stand just like 2ft x 2ft… The luggage can keep under the bed, no extra furniture, only basic, aircond is working well, tv reception is good, and free secured wifi is provided. Free water refill is provided at the corridor, feel like sound block is not so good, people talking in outside can hear clearly when refilling water… One important point for those tourist want to stay in this kind of guest house, I just 165cm tall, the bed I sleep just nice to fit in, feel like the bed is 180cm length only. For those tall guy please check before you stay in. In the same time I also visit others room when the maid cleaning the other rooms, I found that 3 single bed room is the best, endless city view and space enough. Single bed room is no window, dark in the room. Recommended if you have a bit extra money and want to stay more comfortable, 2 people can select 3 bed room, 1 person can select twin bed room. The building is a bit old, but this guest house has been refurbished, feel comfortable. What others said, the ground floor is a bit mess, while there are many stalls and money exchange which very convenience tourists. The building management is well managed, everything arranged in order, tourist needs patient to queue and wait for the lift. The location is good, Chung King Mansion is well-known, just mentioned the building name to bus driver, he will stop at the closer bus stop, just walk within two minutes distance. A21 is the direct bus from airport to the location. Restaurant and shopping center are around the area, very convenience. Everything is fine, if the room is just a sleep in your journey.

Reviews.Title: “Booking does not work”
Reviews.Author: Erkki K
Reviews.Content: I booked this place throw the tripadvisor venere.com, received the booking confirmation to e-mail. 3 months before i went to Hong Kong. The day i went to Hong Kong, first need to look this place almost 30 minutes, was so hard to find and when i arrived, they said: "we are full and your booking does not account here, you can't get the room". Since it was saturday evening and i was alone with big baggage, looking for other places was very tiresome, because all places were full, finally i found one place, but need to pay 5 times more for night. This place is very unreliable, never can't sure if your booking will work.

Reviews.Title: “Tight for space”
Reviews.Author: Brendan D
Reviews.Content: The title could describe any room in Hong Kong but it was tiny.the only room available was a twin so myself and my girlfriend had to take it.We stayed Two nights as we had booked onward flights,would have liked longer in the city.On the plus side it was on Nathan road which is a lively busy street in the middle of it all. The subway across the road could get you anywhere. The lady there (not the manager) hadn't got great English but when we lost a bag on the bus she did every thing she could to help and we eventually got it back. The entrance to "the Mansions" is pretty daunting especially when arriving at night but the hostel itself is very modern and clean.The ground floor of the block is teeming with people and there are queue's for the lifts,but doesn't take long. All in all a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “ok priced hostel with need to beware.”
Reviews.Author: nathalie g
Reviews.Content: Booked for one night at park guest house, but they were full....! so they put me in another guest house on floor 11. which was fine, if it wasn't for the reason that I also checked that guest house on booking.com and it was 20€cheaper....... generally okay for the money, but need not be booked long in advance, cheaper to get there and deal with the price on the spot. HORRIBLE entrance with drug trafficking, heckling tailor / second hotel / fake sales, etc. had booked Park Guest House, but it was full so I had to stay at New International Guest House ist. which is 1 / 3 cheaper than Park Guest House, but I had to pay the same price as a park guest house .......... not a nice breakfast place nearby. no one manning the front desk. no check on something, for example. I did not use the mini-bar. because it was empty. when they claimed that I had used up everything and would therefore pay for the entire fridge normal content ...... ie. you have to check room and report any 'abnormal' already when you check-in. to avoid discussions / fights when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for me but not my friend”
Reviews.Author: PEL0624
Reviews.Content: This guest house was great for 3 of us in a room. Clean & comfortable with small bathroom. My friend's room was not so good because she said every morning, the smell of cooking kept on went into her room and can't sleep & rest in the early morning. The whole room smell like oily. Friendly maid & Mrs.Lau. They clean your room everyday. Wifi is available. Security is good if you don't mind the people downstairs that keep touting you. The MTR just opposite Chung King Mansion. Everything is so near & convenient. If I go to HK, I will go this guest house again but not those rooms near to people's always do cooking..

Reviews.Title: “Far too small.”
Reviews.Author: Laurentina73
Reviews.Content: In all fairness I had not really meant to book this place. I thought I had booked into the Park Hotel. The room was clean and the owner lady was very kind and understanding. But we took one look around us and fled to a lovely hotel nearby (The Kowloon)

Reviews.Title: “Clean but tiny”
Reviews.Author: scarlettraveller_10
Reviews.Content: The guesthouse is probably the best in the building. Located on the top floor, it was easy to get the lift down. However, the lift was the real main problem with the place as it was small and stopped at almost every floor even though it was already full. The ground floor is full of people touting. If you can get over that and the lift, then the place is actually good. The rooms are small but clean. It's newly renovated and so its shiny and nice. Good budget place.

Reviews.Title: “Best clean!!”
Reviews.Author: NuOuMZa
Reviews.Content: Small room(same the other in this area) ,best clean, nice location, center of shopping

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, good location”
Reviews.Author: chk86
Reviews.Content: Very very tiny rooms, located in Chungking mansions. The location is perfect- right near subway station, ferry rides and other attractions like museum etc. But chungking mansion corridor is quite shady and there is a waiting time for the elevators during peak hours. The room is extremely tiny, you have to keep the luggage under the bed and taking stuff out of the suitcase is slightly difficult. The bathroom is just the size of a flight restroom. But it is very clean and well maintained. the lady owner is a very nice and friendly person- had mailed her would be there post midnight due to late flight. But flight was further delayed and I reached at 2- yet she was there waiting for me to check in. she didnt even ask for money till I paid the next day. Good place to stay if you are on a budget trip, provided you dont mind the shady and harmless lobby of chungking mansion

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but beware.”
Reviews.Author: tigger82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The location is good but initially when I stepped off the bus from the airport I was harrased by lots of people trying to stay at their hotel/guest house. There are many other guest houses in the Chung King Mansion. There was a long queue to use the lift and the ground floor was full of dodgey looking people but they never seemed to bother me. I stayed in a single room which was the smallest room i've ever been in, I had to climb over my bag to get into bed and you could literally have a shower sat on the toilet. The room was cheap though and spotlessly clean so it did the job and I wasn't in my room other than to sleep. Whilst I was staying here I overheard a falling out between another guest and the owner. Apparently a door had fallen off which they said was broken before but she insisted on blaming them. In the end the police were called and the guests had to pay up. To me it seemed as though they were paying for repairs.......if you do stay here report any problems at the beginiing of your stay so you can't be blamed later!

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced for a budget stay. Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeanGuest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Guest House for a night (3rd May) before continuing my travel plans to China. I was scheduled to return to HK to stay in Park Guest House for 2 more nights (6th & 7th May) after returning from China. Upon check-in, we were ushered into Hollywood Guest House instead of Park Guest House with no Internet access, and extremely noisy construction work on a Sat noon. The owner' Fillipino maid immediately returned us HKD680 when we wanted to call the police. I decided to stay in another Guest House on the same level with no construction noise at price HKD220 a night. On that same night, this demanding owner from Park Guest House came to quarrel with the worker from the neighbor guest house and even hit him. Despite giving the owner verbal prior notice 2 days in advance, that I am staying only a night, instead of 2 nights she wanted to charge me HKD1,030 for both nights. She took advantage of the situation as she has confirmation on paper that booking was made for 2 nights. Eventually a police report was made against Park Guest House to safe-guard my interest as I did not stayed with Park Guest House on the 2 nights. Although Park Guest House is indeed one of the more popular Guest House, with clean rooms. However charges is over-priced for HKD680 a night as their neighbor guest house is only charging HKD220 with the same cleanliness. It was overall an unpleasant experience with Park Guest House and definately not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “read this before you book”
Reviews.Author: Birk_11
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very very small. They already look small in the pictures, but the pictures are misleading - they are even smaller. The double bed is a big single bed. The washrooms including the shower are at the size of an airplane's washroom. There is no separate place to shower - there is just a hose near the toilet. Two people cannot walk in the room at the same time. The elevator is extremely slow, and there is usually a long queue to it. Rooms are clean. Book this hostel only if you are a broke backpacker who is not willing to spend a few extra dollars for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms in Chunking Mansion”
Reviews.Author: Etravers2
Reviews.Content: Chunking Mansion is crazy, not for everyone. Ground Floor when you go in first is mental, people trying to sell you things and bring you to hotels. I would not advise doing that, if you are going to stay make sure to check it online first as there are definitely some dodgy people around. We were on the1 5th floor, clean and tiled corridor. Rooms are incredibly small, we had a twin room as there was no doubles available at the time. Very overpriced for what you get. Room was clean and bathroom minuscule. I'm 5ft 3 and had to really bend to brush my teeth in the sink. Fine place if you just want to sleep, you could not spend any amount of time in there, very claustrophobic. The lift is not that bad and security guards and cameras there. Did not feel overly safe but definitely not as bad as I expected. Good Location though. Looked better than a lot of other places in Chunking. In conclusion expect the worst and you may be slightly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place, super small room.”
Reviews.Author: maryamosmond
Reviews.Content: A Chinese lady attended to us. It's hard to comprehend her english. But we managed through it. The room shocked me. When I read it was small I really didn't think it's be THAT SMALL. but for a vacation where you only shower and sleep, you don't need big rooms, right? Double bed on the left, side table straight ahead and small toilet to my right. You keep your things under the bed. You don't need aircon cos the weather is cold enough. My partner and I agreed that this room was not so bad afterall. It was clean. Security was good. Lift waiting problem was, urm, manageable. For HK$380, it's OK since the location is so close to everything you want in TST.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets =)”
Reviews.Author: mariadivina23
Reviews.Content: My 3 companions stayed there for 2 nights. Location wise its accesible to MTR & bus, just a little walk to avenue of stars where we watch symphony of lights. The room is clean, bathroom & linen. I have heard noisy neighbor. Its a good choice, been travelling to SG, not like in HK, accomodation much cheaper They offered distilled water too, just bring a tumbler, you just refill all you like. The room service is a fellow Pinay, we spoke the same dialect...=)

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money and location for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: 2530kaki
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean throughout. Excellent location directly opposite the bus stop for Airport shuttle bus, especially for an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price, but don't expect more”
Reviews.Author: XCitiMom
Reviews.Content: The hostel itself is clean and new. There was a slight problem with one of the two rooms we reserved not being available when we arrived despite my sending a reconfirmation email a week before we arrived, but it was readily settled. The rooms are very tiny, and in 1501, the toilet/shower cubicle is transparent glass on one side and just a shower curtain on another side - there is no privacy at all when using the bathroom. Two peoiple sharing a room need to move around each other to be able to go to/from the bathroom. There is only about half a meter between the bed and the wall. You need to put your luggage under the bed. Linen and towels are clean but spartan. There were working TV sets in the rooms, but the only English channel is BBC, and it did not have sound. So we had to content ourselves with watching the videos and reading the tickers underneath. And this was at the time that the earthquake and tsunami struck Japan. Wifi access did not work in one of the rooms we used (1522), and we were bothered by the smell of cooking which came from the window even though we kept it closed. The building however, looks seedy both from the outside and inside the ground floor lobby. The lobby looks like an alley, and there are lots of people hanging around with a predatory air for tourists. There is a person manning the entrance to the two elevators; during rush hour there can be a long wait since each elevator can only carry at most 8 passengers - less if there is luggage. Ludy, the Filipina taking care of the entire 18-room hostel is very efficient and warm. The owner/manager stays at the 11th floor where she also has another hostel called New International Guest House. For budget travel this is okay, you can do a lot worse. The location is excellent. Going to/from the airport costs only HK$33 one way using the A21 bus which stops just a few meters from the Chungking Mansion entrance coming from the airport, and about a block North when going to the airport. The MTR station is also a few meters down Nathan Road. You can easily walk to the ferry terminal. about ten minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, and convenience”
Reviews.Author: fadedcloud
Reviews.Content: You pay what you get for. The Guest House location was great and the place was clean, but everything else was ok. We had a double size room for 4 days. The lobby of the building almost scared me away in the first place. The Guess House is located in the 15th floor of Chun Qing building. A very old building in Hong Kong. 1st floor is very crowded due to a lot of people selling stuffs. There is only two elevators going up and down the building. The line for the elevators is quite long during the day. You will fine as long as if you are planning on going out early in the day, and coming back late in the night. If you don't want to wait, you can take the stair, but be aware, that is where the trash is. The room is only large enough to fit the bed (there is space for luggages under the bed), the shower stand (clear glass), and the door. If you want to use the toilet and do not want to sleep in a stinky room, there is a separate bathroom in the corner. There is no shampoo, hair conditioner, tooth paste or tooth bush...etc. You have to bring your own or buy it from the stores down stair. If you are visiting Hong Kong during winter time, it might be a good idea to bring a small bottle of lotion, the place is kind of dry. The room is mostly clean, the wall is covered with ceramic tiles. Bath towel and bed sheets are change on daily basis. They seem to be clean. Only thing I ran into was the ants. I had ants coming from the door. I did not count the exact number of ants, they are maybe in between 20-30 range. I was not bothered by ants, but I just want to mention this anyway. There is only one lady managing the place. She is only there from noon to mid night. If you need clean towel or tissue paper, you better get then in those time frame. There is a 20in LG LCD TV in the room and free wifi. I had no problem getting online. I don't know how busy is this place. I booked my room through an website from Trip Advisor. It would be a good idea to book the place in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean but small.”
Reviews.Author: TrishAS
Reviews.Content: Prior to my booking for this hostel, I've read many reviews of how small HK hostels are. I was proven right for this one. We booked a room for 4 and got 2 double beds. Each side by the wall and the remaining walk space is still limited. BUT I've service is good, room get made up every day. Toilet is small but very clean and neat (I think it's newly renovated). Hallway is quiet and safe. The lady tending to the guesthouse is very friendly too. Our flight back is in the evening and she helped keep our luggages till we're ready to collect. Location is good. Entrance to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR is just across the road. The only downside is its location in Chung King Mansion. I don't feel safe in the building if I'm alone and lift is small and slow. We have to queue up every evening to get a space in it. But still it isn't a big problem. Overall, I'll recommend if you're traveling in 2 or more for the safety aspect. And if you just want a comfy room to sleep every evening (this is a hostel afterall) this is the one to consider!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: randomnickname
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small - it's the first time I've stayed somewhere smaller than a Japanese business hotel. However, the room was spotlessly clean and newly renovated, the management friendly, and the room safe. We had a 'standard 3 person', which had a double bed and a single one, with a bedside table between them. The double bed does fit two people, but you need to be really friendly with the other person. The bathroom is equally tiny, but was clean with no mildew. The door was lockable from the inside via a deadbolt. The room had a TV, AC, and a small bar fridge, and we were provided with towels, toilet tissue and duvets, plus soap and body wash dispensers in the bathroom. The hostel itself requires a key card to enter. We were able to check our luggage the next day. The location is very convenient - walking distance to the MTR, Ferry, History Museum etc. Chungking Mansion itself does look a bit seedy, but it's not nearly as intimidating as places like Pahar Ganj in India or Khao San road in Bangkok, and the neighbourhood itself is fine. You will have to wait for the elevator, as there are only two tiny lifts for the whole building. The room wasn't silent, but was surprisingly quiet for the middle of Hong Kong. So, if you need a place to stay in Hong Kong without spending $200 a night, and want somwhere basic, clean and safe to sleep, I'd definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean but small...”
Reviews.Author: faceman01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early April after staying 1 night on the 3rd floor at some cockroach infested place I can't remember the name of! We visited about 10 other Guesthouses in Chung King Mansions and chose to stay here. The room had only just been renovated, the aircon unit, tv, bathroom fittings were all absolutely brand new! The sheets were crisp and clean, it was great. The only thing that was wrong was the size of the room, it was tiny!! Most of the rooms we saw in Chung King Mansions were tiny so this came as no surprise but I hd to put my backpack under the bed so we had space to walk around the room! On our tour of the mansion block we did find bigger rooms (on the 5th floor but they were much more expensive) but the rooms at Park House GH were the best we saw. We paid 220 Hong Kong$ per night which was pretty good value as Hong Kong is an expensive city to stay in!

HotelInfo.Name: Park Guest House
HotelInfo.Address: A1 15/Floor Block A, Chung King Mansion, 36-44 Nathan Road, Tsimshatsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
